intro: Varronia oxyphylla, commonly known as the white cedar, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by elongated, woody fruits containing several seeds. Varronia oxyphylla is often found in moist, lowland forests and is valued for its durable wood. It also has traditional medicinal uses in some indigenous communities.
